caption: Table 1: Comparison of different strategies in addressing CF, TC, and Bias-Correction (BC).
description: This table summarizes the theoretical analysis of various class-incremental learning strategies.  It shows whether each strategy effectively mitigates catastrophic forgetting (CF), task confusion (TC), and bias correction (BC).  The "Theoretical Remarks" column references specific corollaries and hypotheses from the paper that support the analysis for each strategy.

caption: Table 2: The means and ± SEMs of accuracies in class-IL scenarios with 10 runs on four benchmarks.
description: This table presents the average classification accuracy (± standard error of the mean) achieved by various class-incremental learning (class-IL) strategies across four benchmark datasets (MNIST, CIFAR-10, CIFAR-100, and CORE50).  Each strategy's performance is shown, with the "None" row representing a baseline without any specific class-IL technique, and the "Joint" row showing the upper bound achievable if all classes were trained together. The table is divided into sections showing results for different classes of techniques: Regularization, Distillation, Bias-Correction, Generative Replay, and Generative Classifier.
